message.raw:
adjust AtlasState.msg to fit under 1500 bytes to prevent UDP fragmentation.

1350 bytes = 24(header) + 3*28*4(state) + 6*28*4(pid) + (4+2*3)*8(imu) + 4*6*8(wrench) + 9*4(array header) + 10(udp datagram)
message.html:
adjust AtlasState.msg to fit under 1500 bytes to prevent UDP fragmentation.

1350 bytes = 24(header) + 3284(state) + 6284(pid) + (4+23)8(imu) + 468(wrench) + 9*4(array header) + 10(udp datagram)

message.raw:
Workaround for problem with cmake auto quoting and bourne shell

When placing a variable assigment in front of a command, cmake will
place double quotes around variable assigment and bourne shell will
try to run it as a command.

Use a double cmake COMMAND to workaround this problem.
message.html:
Workaround for problem with cmake auto quoting and bourne shell

When placing a variable assigment in front of a command, cmake will
place double quotes around variable assigment and bourne shell will
try to run it as a command.

Use a double cmake COMMAND to workaround this problem.

message.raw:
Added Gaussian noise to model of laser in multisense-sl, per issue #159.

To make it work, I extensively restructured the gazebo_ros_laser plugin, making
it much simpler.  Now it has no threads.  When the first ROS subscriber hooks up,
the plugin subscribes to the Gazebo laser sensor.  When Gazebo publishes a new laser
message, the plugin receives it, converts it to ROS laser message, then
publishes it.  When the last ROS subscriber disconnects, the plugin unsubscribes
from the Gazebo sensor.
message.html:
Added Gaussian noise to model of laser in multisense-sl, per issue #159.

To make it work, I extensively restructured the gazebo_ros_laser plugin, making
it much simpler. Now it has no threads. When the first ROS subscriber hooks up,
the plugin subscribes to the Gazebo laser sensor. When Gazebo publishes a new laser
message, the plugin receives it, converts it to ROS laser message, then
publishes it. When the last ROS subscriber disconnects, the plugin unsubscribes
from the Gazebo sensor.

Added Gaussian noise to model of laser in multisense-sl, per issue #159.

To make it work, I extensively restructured the gazebo_ros_laser plugin, making
it much simpler.  Now it has no threads.  When the first ROS subscriber hooks up,
the plugin subscribes to the Gazebo laser sensor.  When Gazebo publishes a new laser
message, the plugin receives it, converts it to ROS laser message, then
publishes it.  When the last ROS subscriber disconnects, the plugin unsubscribes
from the Gazebo sensor.

message.raw:
=== Inertia Updates ===
This inertia updates are based on following algorithm:

  * In the constrained direction, (fortunately for Atlas, affected principal axis aligns with the link axis),
    Principal Moments of Inertia (MOI) are distributed equally between connected links.  This change should
    have no effect on the dynamics of the overall system (and should probably be performed autonomously
    by LCP solvers in general).
  * In unconstrained directions, limit the mass ratio across connected links to a manually defined ratio.,
    This change does affect CG location and overall inertia of links, but we check to see that
    the overall CG change is not significant.
  * In unconstrained directions, change the MOI so ratio across the joint is limited.
    This is not done in any consistent manner in this commit.  For example, the talus IXX is directly
    set as 0.5 * IXX of foot.

=== Links Affected ===
 * There are 3 link chains being updated. In each of these chains, the intermediate link(s) have much smaller inertia than the end links:
   a) utorso <back_ubx> mtorso <back_mby> ltorso <back_lbz> pelvis
      * mass is distributed 5:1 across utorso and mtorso links.  Anticipating utorso link might grow
        significantly with the addition of Atlas power pack.
      * IYY is bewteen utorso and mtorso is distributed equally.
      * IXX of mtorso is set to 0.5 of mtorso IXX.
      * mass is distributed 10:1 across pelvis:ltorso.  Overall CG change is checked to make sure it’s
        not significant (change of 0.409, 0, -0.861mm).
      * IZZ of utorso, mtorso and ltorso distributed equally.
        Overall IZZ of utorso, mtorso, ltorso at lbz is checked to make sure there are no changes.
      * IYY, IXX of pelvis and ltorso are distributed equally, being constrained, should not affect dynamics.
   b) pelvis <*_leg_uhz> *_uglut <*_leg_mhx> *_lglut <*_leg_lhy> *_uleg
      * This adjustment is done after the adjustments in a) are performed.
      * mass is distributed 10:1 between pelvis:uglut, uleg:lglut.  Checking CG shift (-0.405, 0.227, -1.561mm).
      * IZZ distributed equally between uglut, lglut and uleg, and check combined IZZ about uleg/lbz for sanity.
      * IYY distributed equally between pelvis, uglut, lglut, and check combined IYY about pelvis link for sanity.
      * IXX distributed euqally between uglut and pelvis.  Constrained in x, so should have no effect
        on dynamics.  Check combined IXX of pelvis and uglut about lglut(mhx).
      * IXX distributed euqally between lglut and uleg.  Constrained, so should have no effect on dynamics.
        Check combined IXX of lglut and uleg about lglut(mhx).
   c) *_lleg <l_leg_uay> *_talus <l_leg_lax> *_foot
      * mass is distributed between talus and foot link.  Afterwards, CG of both links combined is checked
        to ensure it has not moved much.
      * IYY is distributed equally between talus and foot, given y-direction is constrained, it does
        not really matter how we distribute them.
      * IXX of talus is set to 0.5 * (IXX of foot).  Foot IXX is held constant so same response is expected.
        Combined IXX of foot and talus is check to make sure there are no significant changes (3.67%).
      * IZZ (like IYY) is distributed equally between talus and foot with no impact to simulation dynamics.

 * Also, hokuyo_link of the MultiSense SL sensor has much smaller inertia then its parent link (head).
      * IYY IZZ distributed equally between head and hokuyo_link (being constrained).
      * IXX of hokuyo_link is set to 1/10 of head and hokuyo_link combined IXX.
message.html:
=== Inertia Updates ===
This inertia updates are based on following algorithm:

  • In the constrained direction, (fortunately for Atlas, affected principal axis aligns with the link axis),
    Principal Moments of Inertia (MOI) are distributed equally between connected links. This change should
    have no effect on the dynamics of the overall system (and should probably be performed autonomously
    by LCP solvers in general).
  • In unconstrained directions, limit the mass ratio across connected links to a manually defined ratio.,
    This change does affect CG location and overall inertia of links, but we check to see that
    the overall CG change is not significant.
  • In unconstrained directions, change the MOI so ratio across the joint is limited.
    This is not done in any consistent manner in this commit. For example, the talus IXX is directly
    set as 0.5 * IXX of foot.

=== Links Affected ===
* There are 3 link chains being updated. In each of these chains, the intermediate link(s) have much smaller inertia than the end links:
a) utorso <back_ubx> mtorso <back_mby> ltorso <back_lbz> pelvis
* mass is distributed 5:1 across utorso and mtorso links. Anticipating utorso link might grow
significantly with the addition of Atlas power pack.
* IYY is bewteen utorso and mtorso is distributed equally.
* IXX of mtorso is set to 0.5 of mtorso IXX.
* mass is distributed 10:1 across pelvis:ltorso. Overall CG change is checked to make sure it’s
not significant (change of 0.409, 0, -0.861mm).
* IZZ of utorso, mtorso and ltorso distributed equally.
Overall IZZ of utorso, mtorso, ltorso at lbz is checked to make sure there are no changes.
* IYY, IXX of pelvis and ltorso are distributed equally, being constrained, should not affect dynamics.
b) pelvis <_leg_uhz> _uglut <_leg_mhx> _lglut <_leg_lhy> _uleg
* This adjustment is done after the adjustments in a) are performed.
* mass is distributed 10:1 between pelvis:uglut, uleg:lglut. Checking CG shift (-0.405, 0.227, -1.561mm).
* IZZ distributed equally between uglut, lglut and uleg, and check combined IZZ about uleg/lbz for sanity.
* IYY distributed equally between pelvis, uglut, lglut, and check combined IYY about pelvis link for sanity.
* IXX distributed euqally between uglut and pelvis. Constrained in x, so should have no effect
on dynamics. Check combined IXX of pelvis and uglut about lglut(mhx).
* IXX distributed euqally between lglut and uleg. Constrained, so should have no effect on dynamics.
Check combined IXX of lglut and uleg about lglut(mhx).
c) _lleg <l_leg_uay> _talus <l_leg_lax> *_foot
* mass is distributed between talus and foot link. Afterwards, CG of both links combined is checked
to ensure it has not moved much.
* IYY is distributed equally between talus and foot, given y-direction is constrained, it does
not really matter how we distribute them.
* IXX of talus is set to 0.5 * (IXX of foot). Foot IXX is held constant so same response is expected.
Combined IXX of foot and talus is check to make sure there are no significant changes (3.67%).
* IZZ (like IYY) is distributed equally between talus and foot with no impact to simulation dynamics.

  • Also, hokuyo_link of the MultiSense SL sensor has much smaller inertia then its parent link (head).
    • IYY IZZ distributed equally between head and hokuyo_link (being constrained).
    • IXX of hokuyo_link is set to 1/10 of head and hokuyo_link combined IXX.

    This is not done in any consistent manner in this commit.  For example, the talus IXX is directly
    set as 0.5 * IXX of foot.

=== Links Affected ===
 * There are 3 link chains being updated. In each of these chains, the intermediate link(s) have much smaller inertia than the end links:
   a) utorso <back_ubx> mtorso <back_mby> ltorso <back_lbz> pelvis

   b) pelvis <*_leg_uhz> *_uglut <*_leg_mhx> *_lglut <*_leg_lhy> *_uleg
      * This adjustment is done after the adjustments in a) are performed.

      * IZZ distributed equally between uglut, lglut and uleg, and check combined IZZ about uleg/lbz for sanity.

        Combined IXX of foot and talus is check to make sure there are no significant changes (3.67%).
      * IZZ (like IYY) is distributed equally between talus and foot with no impact to simulation dynamics.

 * Also, hokuyo_link of the MultiSense SL sensor has much smaller inertia then its parent link (head).
      * IYY IZZ distributed equally between head and hokuyo_link (being constrained).
      * IXX of hokuyo_link is set to 1/10 of head and hokuyo_link combined IXX.
summary.html:
=== Inertia Updates ===
This inertia updates are based on following algorithm:

  • In the constrained direction, (fortunately for Atlas, affected principal axis aligns with the link axis),
    Principal Moments of Inertia (MOI) are distributed equally between connected links. This change should
    have no effect on the dynamics of the overall system (and should probably be performed autonomously
    by LCP solvers in general).
  • In unconstrained directions, limit the mass ratio across connected links to a manually defined ratio.,
    This change does affect CG location and overall inertia of links, but we check to see that
    the overall CG change is not significant.
  • In unconstrained directions, change the MOI so ratio across the joint is limited.
    This is not done in any consistent manner in this commit. For example, the talus IXX is directly
    set as 0.5 * IXX of foot.

=== Links Affected ===
* There are 3 link chains being updated. In each of these chains, the intermediate link(s) have much smaller inertia than the end links:
a) utorso <back_ubx> mtorso <back_mby> ltorso <back_lbz> pelvis
* mass is distributed 5:1 across utorso and mtorso links. Anticipating utorso link might grow
significantly with the addition of Atlas power pack.
* IYY is bewteen utorso and mtorso is distributed equally.
* IXX of mtorso is set to 0.5 of mtorso IXX.
* mass is distributed 10:1 across pelvis:ltorso. Overall CG change is checked to make sure it’s
not significant (change of 0.409, 0, -0.861mm).
* IZZ of utorso, mtorso and ltorso distributed equally.
Overall IZZ of utorso, mtorso, ltorso at lbz is checked to make sure there are no changes.
* IYY, IXX of pelvis and ltorso are distributed equally, being constrained, should not affect dynamics.
b) pelvis <_leg_uhz> _uglut <_leg_mhx> _lglut <_leg_lhy> _uleg
* This adjustment is done after the adjustments in a) are performed.
* mass is distributed 10:1 between pelvis:uglut, uleg:lglut. Checking CG shift (-0.405, 0.227, -1.561mm).
* IZZ distributed equally between uglut, lglut and uleg, and check combined IZZ about uleg/lbz for sanity.
* IYY distributed equally between pelvis, uglut, lglut, and check combined IYY about pelvis link for sanity.
* IXX distributed euqally between uglut and pelvis. Constrained in x, so should have no effect
on dynamics. Check combined IXX of pelvis and uglut about lglut(mhx).
* IXX distributed euqally between lglut and uleg. Constrained, so should have no effect on dynamics.
Check combined IXX of lglut and uleg about lglut(mhx).
c) _lleg <l_leg_uay> _talus <l_leg_lax> *_foot
* mass is distributed between talus and foot link. Afterwards, CG of both links combined is checked
to ensure it has not moved much.
* IYY is distributed equally between talus and foot, given y-direction is constrained, it does
not really matter how we distribute them.
* IXX of talus is set to 0.5 * (IXX of foot). Foot IXX is held constant so same response is expected.
Combined IXX of foot and talus is check to make sure there are no significant changes (3.67%).
* IZZ (like IYY) is distributed equally between talus and foot with no impact to simulation dynamics.

  • Also, hokuyo_link of the MultiSense SL sensor has much smaller inertia then its parent link (head).
    • IYY IZZ distributed equally between head and hokuyo_link (being constrained).
    • IXX of hokuyo_link is set to 1/10 of head and hokuyo_link combined IXX.

values.message:
=== Inertia Updates ===
This inertia updates are based on following algorithm:

  * In the constrained direction, (fortunately for Atlas, affected principal axis aligns with the link axis),
    Principal Moments of Inertia (MOI) are distributed equally between connected links.  This change should
    have no effect on the dynamics of the overall system (and should probably be performed autonomously
    by LCP solvers in general).
  * In unconstrained directions, limit the mass ratio across connected links to a manually defined ratio.,
    This change does affect CG location and overall inertia of links, but we check to see that
    the overall CG change is not significant.
  * In unconstrained directions, change the MOI so ratio across the joint is limited.
    This is not done in any consistent manner in this commit.  For example, the talus IXX is directly
    set as 0.5 * IXX of foot.

=== Links Affected ===
 * There are 3 link chains being updated. In each of these chains, the intermediate link(s) have much smaller inertia than the end links:
   a) utorso <back_ubx> mtorso <back_mby> ltorso <back_lbz> pelvis
      * mass is distributed 5:1 across utorso and mtorso links.  Anticipating utorso link might grow
        significantly with the addition of Atlas power pack.
      * IYY is bewteen utorso and mtorso is distributed equally.
      * IXX of mtorso is set to 0.5 of mtorso IXX.
      * mass is distributed 10:1 across pelvis:ltorso.  Overall CG change is checked to make sure it’s
        not significant (change of 0.409, 0, -0.861mm).
      * IZZ of utorso, mtorso and ltorso distributed equally.
        Overall IZZ of utorso, mtorso, ltorso at lbz is checked to make sure there are no changes.
      * IYY, IXX of pelvis and ltorso are distributed equally, being constrained, should not affect dynamics.
   b) pelvis <*_leg_uhz> *_uglut <*_leg_mhx> *_lglut <*_leg_lhy> *_uleg
      * This adjustment is done after the adjustments in a) are performed.
      * mass is distributed 10:1 between pelvis:uglut, uleg:lglut.  Checking CG shift (-0.405, 0.227, -1.561mm).
      * IZZ distributed equally between uglut, lglut and uleg, and check combined IZZ about uleg/lbz for sanity.
      * IYY distributed equally between pelvis, uglut, lglut, and check combined IYY about pelvis link for sanity.
      * IXX distributed euqally between uglut and pelvis.  Constrained in x, so should have no effect
        on dynamics.  Check combined IXX of pelvis and uglut about lglut(mhx).
      * IXX distributed euqally between lglut and uleg.  Constrained, so should have no effect on dynamics.
        Check combined IXX of lglut and uleg about lglut(mhx).
   c) *_lleg <l_leg_uay> *_talus <l_leg_lax> *_foot
      * mass is distributed between talus and foot link.  Afterwards, CG of both links combined is checked
        to ensure it has not moved much.
      * IYY is distributed equally between talus and foot, given y-direction is constrained, it does
        not really matter how we distribute them.
      * IXX of talus is set to 0.5 * (IXX of foot).  Foot IXX is held constant so same response is expected.
        Combined IXX of foot and talus is check to make sure there are no significant changes (3.67%).
      * IZZ (like IYY) is distributed equally between talus and foot with no impact to simulation dynamics.

 * Also, hokuyo_link of the MultiSense SL sensor has much smaller inertia then its parent link (head).
      * IYY IZZ distributed equally between head and hokuyo_link (being constrained).
      * IXX of hokuyo_link is set to 1/10 of head and hokuyo_link combined IXX.

message.raw:
First working version of the ROS API checker.  This tool verifies the presences
of a ROS API that is described in a YAML file.  It'll take in multiple YAML
files, merging their contents, which makes it easy to break the API definition
up into reusable pieces.  For each topic given in the API definition, the tool
will verify the presence of the topic, its type, and the number of publishers
and subscribers (-1 means don't care for the publisher/subscriber count).

In this version, there's a test that verifies the API provided by
atlas.launch (which is Atlas + Multisense-SL) and another for
atlas_sandia_hands.launch (Atlas + Multisense-SL + Sandia hands).  New tests can
be added or composed in a similar fashion.

The tool supports a `strict` flag; if set, it will perform an extra test to
compare the output of `rostopic list` to the set of topics given in the API
definition.  If they're not equal (which means that some extra, unexpected
topics, are either advertised or subscribed), that test will fail.

The `strict` flag is not set on the current tests because there's some API
cleanup yet to be done.

This tool should eventually migrate out of drcsim and into ROS somewhere, likely
rostest.
